intro: Gonostemon acuminatus, commonly known as the slender bladderleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its small, bladder-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces delicate, five-petaled flowers in shades of white and pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer.
